data.title: The Common Touch: Anne of Bourbon-Parma, Princess and Macy’s Employee
data.meta_description: On September 18, 1923, Princess Anne Antoinette Francois Charlotte of Bourbon-Parma was born in Paris, France. She was the second child of Prince René of Bourbon-Parma and Princess Margrethe of…
data.text:
Not all Royals live in castles

Kathy Copeland Padden

·

Follow

Published in

Exploring History

·

6 min read

·

Mar 17, 2021

--

On September 18, 1923, Princess Anne Antoinette Francois Charlotte of Bourbon-Parma was born in Paris, France. She was the second child of Prince René of Bourbon-Parma and Princess Margrethe of Demark. Like most European royalty, she was related to many reigning or former monarchs.

Anne spent her early years with her parents and three brothers in France. When tensions escalated between France and Germany in 1939, the 16-year-old Princess and her family moved to Spain. Soon after, they waved bye-bye to Europe and left for America.

The family settled in New York, where Anne attended school until she was 18. She went on to Parson’s School of Design, where she completed three years of course work in just two years.

To pay for her schooling, Anne took a job as a sales assistant at the Herald Square Macy’s department store in New York City. The ambitious young Princess also worked at Bloomingdale’s and her mother’s hat shop.

War was raging back home in Europe, and Anne was not happy sitting on the sidelines. In…
